I have thought long and hard about what sub to post this in in order to get the best suggestions. I decided on this sub because you are my people and need no further clarification on what I mean and won't think I'm exaggerating.

After getting over some lengthy injuries and mental health issues, I've dedicated myself to fixing my health and I'm already healthier than I've been in many years.

Part of this journey is getting out and walking at a fast pace for at least two miles a day (I'm working up to five minimum). I haven't missed a day in exactly one month today but I'm coming up on a weather problem.

I don't mind going out in the rain but I do not want to get soaked through from the rain. I am looking for something that's waterproof or resistant that won't end up making me physically wetter than I would be if I just went out in a t shirt. 

What do all y'all outdoor physically active people wear to keep the rain off that won't cook you because it's a thousand degrees out? I lived in the Pacific Northwest for many years so I have rain gear but even the lightest jacket I have, while keeping me dry from the rain, makes me feel as if I'm dissolving and I end up smelling like a wet goat. 

Any and all suggestions (other than an umbrella) are appreciated. 

Thanks!
